content.rendered:
Varanasi Bodhgaya Chitrakoot Tour Package

Home » India » Uttar Pradesh » Varanasi Bodhgaya Chitrakoot Tour

Tour Overview

India is known for being the spiritual destination of the world with being home to some of the most religious destinations. The Varanasi and Bodhgaya with Chitrakoot Holiday Package will evoke extreme spiritualism in the visitor’s heart and mind. For 7 Days and 6 Nights, you will be made to experience the rich plethora of vibrant and age-old culture of this pious and one of the oldest living towns in the world.

Varanasi Bodhgaya Chitrakoot Tour Itinerary

Day 1 :Arrival in Varanasi

You will be welcomed into this holy land by our tour representative who will guide and transfer you to your allotted hotel here. After freshening up you will be taken for visit to some of the most highly revered temples here, starting with Kashi Vishwanath Temple (golden temple) which is one of the most popular shrines of Lord Shiva since it is also home to one out of the 12 Jyotirlingas in India. Later you will be taken to Durga Mandir, a bright red temple which was constructed in 18th-century and dedicated to Maa Durga. Finally, you will be taken to Tulsi Manas Mandir, the place where the historical Hindu epic Ramcharitmanas was written by Goswami Tulsidas. During sunset you will be taken for the evening Ganga Aarti on the Dashashwamedh Ghat which is not only beautiful to look at but it also works in spiritually uplifting your soul.

Finally you will head on towards your hotel for the night.

Day 2 :Varanasi – Bodhgaya

Your morning will commence by witnessing a glorious sunrise on a boat ride on the holy River Ganga. You will then be taken to Bodhgaya, which will be a 5 hours road journey. Upon arriving at Bodhgaya you will be duly checked in to your hotel after which you will be made to visit the famous site for Buddhist pilgrimage tourism and one of the cardinal points in Varanasi, Mahabodhi temple – which houses a descendant of the Bodhi tree under which Buddha had attained his enlightenment. After spending some time here you will be taken back to your hotel for staying the night.

Day 3 :Bodhgaya to Varanasi

Early in the morning, you will be made to proceed towards the city of Gaya which is located at a distance of 5 hours from the main town of Bodhgaya. Here you will be made to visit the temple which houses the footprints of Lord Vishnu himself – Vishnupad temple.

Your journey towards Varanasi will then commence which will take 5 hours and upon your arrival there you will be transferred to your allotted hotel here for spending the night.

Your evening will be free for you to explore the neighboring market places and shop for local souvenirs like, Banarasi silk, wooden toys, Gulabi Meenakari, Rudraksh mala and much more. you can also gorge on some locally prepared delicacies like, Chena Dahi Vada, Kachori Sabzi, Malaiyyo, Choor Matar and so much more.

Day 4 :Varanasi – Vindhyachal – Allahabad

Early morning after breakfast you will be transferred to Allahabad while stopping en route at Vindhyachal where you will be made to visit Maa Vindhyavasini Mandir which is dedicated to goddess Durga.

You will then head on towards Allahabad which will be a 2 hour journey, where upon arrival you will be checked into your hotel and later proceed towards the famous confluence of the three rivers Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswati – Triveni Sangam. You will be made to take a holy dip at this highly sacred point and offer your Pooja rituals. You will also be made to visit Allahabad fort from where you will be able to view the ravishing setting sun and browse through the Allahabad museum filled with ancient weaponry and other interesting artifacts.

Before heading back to your hotel you will be taken to Swaraj Bhawan or popularly also known as Anand Bhawan will be your next stop which is a large mansion formerly owned by Motilal Nehru and had served as the Nehru family’s residence.

Day 5 :Allahabad – Ayodhya – Lucknow

Early in the morning, you will be taken to the birthplace of Lord Rama – Ayodhya. Upon your arrival here and after getting you checked in you will be taken for a brief sightseeing tour of the city kick starting with, Hanuman Garhi Temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman where the custom remains that before visiting Lord Rama’s temple you will have to visit Lord Hanuman temple first.

You will then be taken to Dashrath Bhawan – which is located at the center of the town and is known for being the palace of Dashrath in the initial years and Lord Rama along with his siblings is said to have spent his childhood and youth here.

Finally, you will be made to proceed towards Lucknow which is a 2.5 hours long road journey. You will be spending the night here in your allotted hotel.

Day 6 :Lucknow – Naimisharanya – Lucknow

After breakfast, you will be driven to Naimisharanya or popularly known as Neemsar which is located on the banks of the River Gomti (a tributary of River Ganga). A dip in this river is said to be an extremely sacred ritual. It will take 2 hours to reach Naimisharanya the place where Ved Vyas is said to have written the epic Hindu mythology Mahabharata.

You will be made to visit Chakratirth Mandir which holds great relevance to Hindus. Later you will be made to proceed towards Lalita Devi Temple which is one of the most important Shakti Peeths in India.

Later after a wholesome tour of the city you will be transferred back to Lucknow for the night.

Day 7 :Lucknow Sightseeing – Departure

Post breakfast early in the morning you will be taken for a local sightseeing tour of the city starting with a visit to Bara and Chota Imambara – which are the sacred complexes built in 17th century consisting of imposing structures. Rumi Darwaza will be your next stop which is a towering gateway which was built by Asaf-ud-Daula in 1784.

Finally, after an insightful day you will then be headed towards your departure destination from where you will head on to your onward destination.

Price Details

Tour Name Varanasi Bodhgaya Chitrakoot Tour Package
Duration 7 Days / 6 Nights
Destinations Varanasi - Bodhgaya - Chitrakoot
Tour Price 13,300 /-

Chat with specialist who can help plan your tour!

  • +91-971 1616 316

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Have a divine tour in the city of temples Varanasi
    • Have a boat ride early morning welcoming the sun
    • Tour to Bodhgaya
    • On the way to Allahabad visit to the Maa Vindhyavasini Mandir in Vindhyachal
    • Visit to the Triveni Sangam
    • Ayodhya Darshan with Hanuman Mandir and Dashrath Mahal
    • Visit the city of Nawabs Lucknow and enjoy the Nawabi cuisine
    • Visit Naimisharanya, also known as Neemsar, which is located on the banks of the River Gomti.
    • Lalitha Devi Temple visit, another Shaktipeeth
    • Lucknow sightseeing

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for Varanasi Bodhgaya Chitrakoot Tour Package

    Q. What Is Varanasi's Specialty?

    A. For centuries, the land of Varanasi (Kashi) has been the ultimate pilgrimage destination for Hindus. Hindus believe that anyone who dies on the land of Varanasi will be saved and freed from the cycle of birth and rebirth. The origins of Varanasi, the home of Lord Shiva and Parvati, are unknown.

    Q. Which Cuisine Is Well-Known In Varanasi?

    A. Top 8 Famous Varanasi Dishes:

    1. Kachori Sabji.
    2. Chena Dahi Vada.
    3. Baati Chokha, also known as Litti Chokha.
    4. Chooda Matar is a type of goat.
    5. Golgappe with Dahi Chutney.
    6. Tamarind Chaat.
    7. Thandai and Lassi from Banarasi.
    8. Banarasi Paan.
    Q. What Is Varanasi's Most Famous Sweet?

    A. Malaiyyo is another well-known Banaras sweet. It is only available during the winter. The milk is boiled first and then left outside overnight to soak up the goodness of dew. The milk is then flavored with cardamom, pistachio, cream, and saffron the next morning.

    Q. Which Silk Is Well-Known In Varanasi?

    A. The elegant Banarasi Silk Saree, named after the holy city of Varanasi, is a symbol of grandeur and nobility. The sarees are among the finest in India, with gold and silver brocade or zari, fine silk, and opulent embroidery.

    Q. Which Ghat Is The Most Well-Known In Varanasi?

    A. The most well-known is Dashashwamedh Ghat. It is the most popular Ghat and is located near the Vishwanath Temple. Brahma is said to have performed ten Ashwamedha sacrifices here. Every evening, an Aarti is performed here in honor of Shiva, the goddess Ganga, Surya, Agni, and the entire universe.
